title: Apple owns apple.car domain | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Carplay](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Apple appears to have registered three car-related domains, including
apple.car, hinting at its as yet unconfirmed[Apple
Car](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-car-news-rumours-driverless-
price-release-date-electric) project.**

The three domains are apple.car, apple.cars, and apple.auto, as reported by
[MacRumors](http://www.macrumors.com/2016/01/08/apple-car-cars-auto-domains/).

Updated Whois records reveal the Cupertino-based company registered the
domains through sponsoring registrar MarkMonitor Inc.

MarkMonitor is an intermediary that protects companies against domain
squatting, and Apple Inc. is named on the record as the registrant.

**Related:[Apple Car – Everything you need to
know](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-car-news-rumours-driverless-
price-release-date-electric)**

There’s no guarantee that the domains relate to Apple’s car project,
especially seeing as the company has been pushing its CarPlay connectivity
system recently.

CarPlay allows users to access iOS apps through their car’s infortainment
system using Siri voice activation.
